Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

DDK Function: 402H Stop Digital Playback Request

Discussion

Input:

AX = 402H
BX = Driver number

Output:

None

This function requests that digital playback be halted at the end of the current buffer. Since some devices do not function reliably when digitized sample playback is interrupted in progress, the application should not restart playback with a different sample rate or mode until the DST active_buffer variable becomes -1. The application may, however, cancel a pending Stop Digital Playback Request by calling Function 401H (Start Digital Playback Command) with the same mode and sample rate as previously used.


Group: DOS Digital Sound Driver Interface
